Faculty of Science, University of Hradec Králové, Rokitanského 62, 500 03, Hradec Králové, Czech Republic

head.citation-title: Microsaccades, Drifts, Hopf Bundle and Neurogeometry
head.abstracts: © 2022 by the author. Licensee MDPI, Basel, Switzerland.The first part of the paper contains a short review of the image processing in early vision is static, when the eyes and the stimulus are stable, and in dynamics, when the eyes participate in fixation eye movements. In the second part, we give an interpretation of Donders’ and Listing’s law in terms of the Hopf fibration of the 3-sphere over the 2-sphere. In particular, it is shown that the configuration space of the eye ball (when the head is fixed) is the 2-dimensional hemisphere S+L, called Listing hemisphere, and saccades are described as geodesic segments of S+L with respect to the standard round metric. We study fixation eye movements (drift and microsaccades) in terms of this model and discuss the role of fixation eye movements in vision. A model of fixation eye movements is proposed that gives an explanation of presaccadic shift of receptive fields.

affiliation.ce:source-text: Institute for Information Transmission Problems, B. Karetnuj per., 19, 127051, Moscow, Russia

In the second part, we give an interpretation of Donders’ and Listing’s law in terms of the Hopf fibration of the 3-sphere over the 2-sphere. In particular, it is shown that the configuration space of the eye ball (when the head is fixed) is the 2-dimensional hemisphere S+L, called Listing hemisphere, and saccades are described as geodesic segments of S+L with respect to the standard round metric. We study fixation eye movements (drift and microsaccades) in terms of this model and discuss the role of fixation eye movements in vision. A model of fixation eye movements is proposed that gives an explanation of presaccadic shift of receptive fields.
